intro: Corydalis rheinbabeniana var. rheinbabeniana, commonly known as the Rheinbaben corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant features slender, branched stems that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with two upper petals that are larger and more showy than the lower ones. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
